metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6363 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** In the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.2.5, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in tiffWriter in gd_tiff.c. NOTE: the vendor says "In my opinion this issue should not have a CVE, since the GD and GD2 formats are documented to be 'obsolete, and should only be used for development and testing purposes.'"

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.2.5-4ubuntu0.5
libgd3 - 2.2.5-4ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-4ubuntu0.5').
libwmf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
